content:
Hello, I hope you are well. I made this question private since it contains my working code for the finger exercises released today. I got the code to work by testing it in the actual finger exercise portal (I got 100% on the finger exercise), but it wouldn't run in Spyder on my computer. I tried to put it into Python Tutor and it ran infinitely as shown in the screenshot below. It says that a dictionary called _annotations_ was created on step one, but I didn't create a dictionary and this is a new file. Is there a way to fix this? I haven't touched any settings or buttons (I honestly wouldn't even know where to find them) so I am completely lost. (The first screenshot is after pressing "run" in the terminal, the second is the response that Python Tutor gives (I used my code from another exercise because the one from this finger exercise wouldn't all fit in the screenshot, but it is the same result for the other code where nothing is printed and it is instead stored in a dictionary)).

Thank you!

)
subject: Code not running in Spyder or Python Tutor

content:
Ohh I see. Your spyder is running the file called untitled4.py and the code you pasted is in the file called untitled5.py. Save the file first and then run it. 

Regarding the Python Tutor, the print statement from the code isn't of correct syntax. It should be print() not print:

I fixed the print error and it helped with the Python Tutor, but the Spyder still didn’t work. I pressed run several times and no new line appeared in the terminal (those runs were from a previous problem that I was working on, none of them were from working on this problem.) I tried running the same code in several files, in the python tutor, and in my general terminal and none of them worked. Sorry for the issues, I just want to make sure my IDE is working before the microquiz!

The console is stuck in a program that's infinite looped right now, so it's not responding, not even to new programs you run. Go to the 3 horizontal lines by the red square and hit Restart Kernel. That will reset the console. Then try to run this particular file again.

I did this and it seemed to work for a bit, but it stopped working again yesterday during the microquiz (so I had no way to test my code other than the actual microquiz website itself). I can try to come to office hours in the next couple of days to ask in person if needed!
It'll be way easier to figure this out in-person, so I recommend OH!
